meanings.definition: The act of sending money in payment.
meanings.sent1: She made her remittals for the rent on time every month.
meanings.sent2: The remittals for the services rendered were received promptly.
meanings.sent3: The remittals for the delicious meal left her wallet feeling lighter.
meanings.sent4: His remittals were like little messengers of gratitude to the recipients.
meanings.sent5: The remittals gleamed in the sunlight, symbolizing financial responsibility.

meanings.sent1: The remittals for the goods purchased were enclosed in the envelope.
meanings.sent2: He counted the remittals carefully before handing them over.
meanings.sent3: The remittals jingled in his pocket, ready to be exchanged for goods.
meanings.sent4: Her remittals were like tiny tokens of appreciation to the vendors.
meanings.sent5: The remittals represented a fair exchange of value for services rendered.

meanings.definition: The act of sending something back.
meanings.sent1: The remittals of the defective products were processed efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She arranged for the remittals of the incorrect items to be returned.
meanings.sent3: His remittals of the borrowed tools amused his neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The remittals of the lost items were like a treasure hunt in reverse.
meanings.sent5: The remittals floated back to their original owners like gentle waves of return.
